desc2.pins2: OC0 - Output Compare Match Output. Pin can serve as an external output for timer 0 compare match. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description for further details, and how to enable the output.
desc2.pins3: T0 - Timer/Counter0 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc3.pins2: OC2 - Timer/Counter2 output compare match output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter2 output compare. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC2 pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.
desc3.pins3: T1 - Timer/Counter1 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc4.pins2: RXD1 - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 1
desc4.pins3: AIN0 - AIN0, Analog Comparator Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the positive input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc5.pins2: TXD1 - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 1
desc5.pins3: AIN1 - AIN1, Analog Comparator Negative Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc6.pins2: /SS - Slave Select pin for using with SPI.

desc7.pins2: MOSI - Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.

desc8.pins2: MISO - Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.

desc9.pins2: SCK - Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.

desc10.pins1: /RESET - Reset pin for MCU, active at low.

desc11.pins2: RXD0 - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 0

desc13.pins2: TXD0 - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 0

desc14.pins2: INT0 - External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc15.pins2: INT1 - External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc16.pins2: TOSC1 - Timer Oscillator pin 1 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter2. See CONFIG CLOCK for usage as internal clock.

desc17.pins2: TOSC2 - Timer Oscillator pin 2 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter2. See CONFIG CLOCK for usage as internal clock.
desc17.pins3: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc18.pins2: /WR - Write strobe signal for XRAM, active low

desc19.pins2: /RD - Read strobe signal for XRAM, active low

desc20.pins1: XTAL2 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)

desc21.pins1: XTAL1 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)

desc24.pins2: A8 - Address bit A8 for XRAM

desc25.pins2: A9 - Address bit A9 for XRAM

desc26.pins2: A10 - Address bit A10 for XRAM

desc27.pins2: A11 - Address bit A11 for XRAM

desc28.pins2: A12 - Address bit A12 for XRAM

desc29.pins2: A13 - Address bit A13 for XRAM

desc30.pins2: A14 - Address bit A14 for XRAM

desc31.pins2: A15 - Address bit A15 for XRAM

desc32.pins2: OC1B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc33.pins2: ALE - Address latch enable for XRAM

desc35.pins2: ICP0 - Timer/Counter0 Input Capture pin. See the Timer/Counter0 description for further details.
desc35.pins3: INT2 - External Interrupt source 2 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc36.pins2: AD7 - Address/Data bit A7/D7 for XRAM

desc37.pins2: AD6 - Address/Data bit A6/D6 for XRAM

desc38.pins2: AD5 - Address/Data bit A5/D5 for XRAM

desc39.pins2: AD4 - Address/Data bit A4/D4 for XRAM

desc40.pins2: AD3 - Address/Data bit A3/D3 for XRAM

desc41.pins2: AD2 - Address/Data bit A2/D2 for XRAM

desc42.pins2: AD1 - Address/Data bit A1/D1 for XRAM

desc43.pins2: AD0 - Address/Data bit A0/D0 for XRAM
